div.p: VPRS 5834/P0/1, inward correspondence p. 63, VA 1411 Industrial and Technological Museum, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; text-align: center;

margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Clarke is identified as likely correspondent since he was Secretary of the Industrial and Technological Museum. MS is in M's hand. There is an annotation in another hand: 'From the date 7th of Nov. — engage Mr Hoffmann as Phytological Chemist under direction of Dr Von Mueller, at £14.6. a month but cannot pay for months Sept & October as suppose work was departmental 76/I.T.M.'. The annotation has been initialled 'SHB' [i.e. Samuel Bindon].

seg.seg: PUBLIC LIBRARY, MUSEUMS, AND NATIONAL GALLERY OF VICTORIA.

div.p:
(See next page)
The 'Accounts settled' section appears on the following page, and the remainder of the document on a separate page after that.
